Photo of Goodman - London, United Kingdom. Say no more.. Mac and cheese

s_L684sTNYutmsAfUj3v1A.text: Having dined at this restaurant with Jurgen, Livi and Serena, I agree, this food is amazing. The service was great - a lot of banter with the waitress and good advice as to what to order and how it was cooked. The food was expertly cooked, they know what they are doing, the steak, oh my god. Didn't need a steak knife to get through this meat. the side of mac and cheese was also brilliant. At £5 for the side, but you get a HUGE bowl.So they did forget our order but when they realised, they fixed it, straight away. They informed us, and already had a way of fixing it and a timeline as to what they were going to do. Fantastic, just the kind of service that this place and others should have.The steaks aren't cheap but you are paying for so much more, you could go for the other options, but at least one person on the table should do the steak so that you can all experience it.This is a special restaurant, not a place you should go everyday but for occasions that warrant it. I will be returning! Thanks to Leanne and Leonie who helped us out.

-DyB-3bYXDHTdpRISYdvOQ.text: Excellent steakhouse. Had the ribeye with both Stilton sauce and au poivre.  Stilton is a red wine and blue cheese sauce that is very interesting but a little rich for me.  The au poivre could have used more poivre. Steak was flavorful and cooked to perfection. Beer selection is a little thin but there is a very good wine list and an excellent whiskey selection.

WhQ1og6_m14YKJpea6PDjg.text: Popped in for dinner alone whilst staying in London.  Grabbed a seat at the bar and a nice glass of a Californian Zinfindell - one of the nicest I've ever had!Ordered the Cumbrian fillet (250g), Beef Dripping Fries and Green Beans with shallots.  It all tasted divine and so flavoursome.  The steak was cooked perfectly!As I've said before, I would definitely recommend Goodmans.  Of the 3 in London, I really think this one (Maddox Street in Mayfair) is the best!

photos.caption: Photo of Goodman - London, United Kingdom. Cumbrian Fillet (250g), Beef Dripping Chips and Green Beans with shallots

KWZ_sqQ7Kt4706qAfvB9Hw.text: I wish I could eat here every day. Who cares about calories and dieting when you can have a big, juicy, delicious and very smoked steak. I'm told they  dry-age the meat which is impressive because that way it brings out the full concentration of flavour. I though only Spanish people did this with the jamon. The interior is classy and cosy but honestly the only thing I can focus on is the tastiest steaks. Meat lovers need to come by.

2gTfSpRJAYh8MP4lpDfHvg.text: This is the best Steak restaurant in London. Simple. The restaurant is great, staff are helpful but not pushy, and the menu is perfect.In terms of food, it's always the fillet for us, medium rare. The meat just melts in your mouth and is simply delicious.Goodman's is number 1 for me as not only is its steak amazing. the sides and starters are amazing as well.The Beef carpaccio and Mac n cheese are also my favourite, and combined with a perfect portion of chips this is the perfect meal!There is nothing more to say, other than if you like steak then you need to come here.

dmsx05f0VTn26-NCOWycPA.text: THE BEST STEAK I've had, any where!  They aged the meats themselves.  The staffs are so very friendly and helpful.  A MUST for steak lovers...

73f62nWwicqtxQuIXmrK0g.text: BOOM.... The perfect steakhouse!Steak lover? Come here, it's incredible! I enjoyed every moment from the food, to the ambience to the pleasant staff.The food here is brilliant, great selection of cuts and perfectly cooked.The restaurant is pretty ambient with romantic/old fashioned lighting, great furniture to keep comfortable on during your visit.I can't express how amazing it was, you just need to visit!

bXQsD-vB7sKFw96sPEirQQ.text: I am a huge eater for quite a slim guy just like my brother! Goodmans is my favourite restaurant out of every single restaurant I know of! Whether it be a 900g T Bone or a 700g chateau Briand, they are cooked specifically to my liking. The lobster Mac & Cheese is my preferred over the truffle but we order both its amazing! Lobster tails are absolutely delicious too!Great quick service, excellent food and will be going again and again for years to come

Y2K72NTv0NXFXTeGxUdXLA.text: Goodman's exceeded my expectations by some way. Yes, I've read the reviews, I've heard the hype and built it up in my mind.The menu is perfect in size with delicious sides to pick from and a separate board of cuts of the day. We shared a starter of tempura prawns. Huge juicy prawns in crunchy batter. Absolutely perfect, never had prawns so well cooked in tempura.Then I had a ribeye steak and my friend had the fillet. Both were perfectly cooked and insanely good. We shared sides: triple cooked chips, hand-cut chips, creamed spinach and...........truffled...........mac&cheese. Lordy, if there's anything I'd like to die after eating, it's this. Creamy, trufflely, soft, rich, silky, yummy, most delicious thing ever. That good. The triple cooked chips were excellent, as was the spinach but the hand-cut chips were more like wedges in texture and it just wasn't what we wanted with our steak. Personal choice. The whole meal came together perfectly, the amazing, charred steak, the soft spinach and mac&cheese, the crunchy chips, totally gorgeous, high quality, beautiful meal.The only negative I can give and it's barely worth noting is that bearnaise sauce was not to my taste and actually, because everything is so flavourful, you don't need sauce. At this point, we were full to the tops of our heads and beyond. But we still had dessert. Nougat dessert with banana sorbet was well thought out in taste and presentation. The crème brulee was executed well.Overall, this place is unforgettable. The service is kind, knowledgeable and helpful. The restaurant is charming and the food is impeccable. It's the perfect place for a steak lover and a celebration. No, it's not cheap but value for money is good here and I can't see anyone leaving disappointed. I'm also going to briefly say that Hawksmoor is a poor little brother in comparison in every way. Their service is too cool to care, their mac&cheese is disappointing and the steaks, not as good. The only thing I can see that's better at Hawksmoor than here is the soft drinks and cocktail list. I'm taking down their rating as a result and am forever converted to Goodman's.
